image.altText: A woman with curly hair and glasses smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: The university paid the former vice-chancellor a severance package of more than $400,000 in income and superannuation.

title.children: Former ANU boss Genevieve Bell receives $400,000 exit pay

image.altText: Radford College

props.synopsis: Financial errors are being blamed for one school being hundreds of thousands of dollars in debt and hiking school fees by 23 per cent.

title.children: 'We will not allow our kids to be thrown under the bus because of bad governance'

image.altText: Laura sits outside and looks seriously into the camera.

props.synopsis: A new report by victim-led advocacy organisation With You We Can makes the case for all victim-survivors of sexual violence to have access to independent legal representation.

title.children: Laura felt unsupported in the justice system. She wants that to change

image.altText: ACT Magistrate Court

props.synopsis: The first person sentenced for a sexual offence after a major review of cases previously rejected by ACT Police has had an appeal over his sentence dismissed.

title.children: Court dismisses appeal against man jailed for raping friend

image.altText: Police tape in front of a street with a house and cars in background.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating after a 71-year-old man who allegedly shot at officers during an attempted arrest was later found dead on a property in Canberra's south.

title.children: Man who allegedly shot at police during DV-related arrest found dead

image.altText: Hands hold a phone with the screen turned up.

props.synopsis: Luke was only minutes into his first shift at his new workplace when he began hearing his colleagues making homophobic comments. Despite being a resident of Australia's most progressive city, he says he no longer feels safe in public.

title.children: In Australia's most progressive city, Luke quit his job because of homophobia

image.altText: A delicate yellow orchid flower, on the end of its green stem.

props.synopsis: Australian cemeteries have become a safe haven for flora and fauna affected by urban expansion, including a rare orchid unique to a small patch of the NSW Mid North Coast.

title.children: Rare orchids and wattles thrive in old cemeteries

image.altText: People holding Australian flags outside Parliament House in Canberra.

props.synopsis: Sovereign citizens are clogging up Australian courts, after the global financial crisis and COVID-19 spurred a surge in the group's numbers in Australia.

title.children: A growing number of sovereign citizens are clogging up courts

image.altText: A young Lebanese man bushwalking.

props.synopsis: A community-led hiking program is introducing migrants to the bush, offering moments of connection, discovery and, for some, a sense of safety.

title.children: 27 migrants went bushwalking hoping to shatter some myths

image.altText: Buildings in ruins after being hit by a cyclone

props.synopsis: A luxury wilderness resort only accessible by sea and air has been significantly damaged in a direct hit from Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina, which made landfall in an extremely remote part of WA.

title.children: Remote luxury resort in WA suffers severe damage after Cyclone Fina’s direct hit

image.altText: A damaged helicopter on a sandbank.

props.synopsis: A former Sea World worker has appeared before a coronial inquest on the moments leading up to the fatal crash of two helicopters in 2023.

title.children: Former worker recalls moments leading up to deadly Sea World helicopter crash

image.altText: Pen over purple and white census forms.

props.synopsis: For the first time, Australia's 2026 Census will ask participants to identify their sexual orientation and gender in a new topic in the population questionnaire.

title.children: New 2026 Census questions the government wants to know about you

image.altText: Cbus super logo on a glass window

props.synopsis: Superannuation giant Cbus will pay a $23.5 million fine after admitting it breached the law over major delays in its handling of insurance claims.

title.children: 'Promise to do better': Super giant Cbus ordered to pay $23.5m fine

image.altText: Pat Cummins running into bowl with a pink ball during a practice session at Cricket Central

props.synopsis: Injured Australian cricketers Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have bowled in the nets as the pace stars attempt to return from injury for the Ashes.

title.children: Cummins bowls with the pink ball in bid to play second Ashes Test

image.altText: A woman taking a selfie with a man and three young children, whose faces have been blurred.

props.synopsis: The family's alternative lifestyle came under scrutiny after the British-Australian couple and their three children were hospitalised last year with mushroom poisoning.

title.children: Children removed from Australian-British couple living off-grid in Italian forest

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The ABC understands convicted child murderer Bevan Spencer von Einem has been taken to the Yatala infirmary in Adelaide where he only has a short time to live.

title.children: Notorious child killer on brink of death in jail

image.altText: A Menulog delivery courier walks to a restaurant

props.synopsis: Uber Eats says a partnership with its fading competitor allows a "smooth transition" for Menulog users as the service delivers its last meals in Australia.

title.children: Duopoly fears as Menulog sends customers to rival in final hours

image.altText: A woman with grey hair wearing a light blue blouse with her hand on her heart

props.synopsis: Viola Ford Fletcher and her family were told to leave and never tell anyone of what happened. It would take 70 years for the massacre to be investigated.

title.children: The Greenwood Massacre, in the words of its oldest survivor

image.altText: The front cover of Superman No 1, showing Superman leaping over a tall building

props.synopsis: The edition was found by three brothers while they were cleaning out their late mother's San Francisco home. Now it has become the most expensive comic ever sold.

title.children: Copy of first Superman comic sells for $14m after being found in attic

image.altText: A shopfront in Southport, Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: The 62-year-old man died today after spending two days in an intensive care unit. A 32-year-old man has been charged over the incident.

title.children: Gold Coast man dies after alleged one-punch attack

image.altText: A seagull stands in the foreground with three more behind it looking huge in compairosn to the people sitting at the beach.

props.synopsis: Animals and objects dwarf humans in Gavin Libotte's unique perspective on suburban life, challenging the way we see the familiar world.

title.children: 'Everything is wondrous': A photographer's fresh perspective sparks intrigue

image.altText: A woman in a bright green jump and multi coloured hat smiling and wearing a baby carrier

props.synopsis: New mum Hannah Gheller says social media became a “shame-inducing tool” during the early postpartum weeks.

title.children: Experts recommend new mums stay offline for six weeks after their baby is born

image.altText: A sketch of a man with grey hair and glasses in a grey jacket, white collared shirt and dark tie.

props.synopsis: Ron Iddles could never have anticipated that a random vehicle check in 1977 would lead to him to giving evidence in a double-murder case almost 50 years later.

title.children: Famous detective’s chance encounter with Easey St murder accused

image.altText: A man in a suit walks out of Parliament House, surrounded by other men.

props.synopsis: David Adeang said in an interview conducted in Nauruan that members of the NZYQ cohort could be returned to their home countries and suggested Australia should remain partially responsible for finding a longer-term solution for the group.

title.children: Nauru president says NZYQ cohort could go home in interview about secretive deal

image.altText: Elon Musk stands wearing a dark suit, in front of vertical black and white striped lights.

props.synopsis: Social media platform X launched a new location tool globally over the weekend to "verify authenticity" of profiles, but some experts says the tool has breached user trust and increased misinformation on the platform.

title.children: New location tool on Musk's X might breach user trust

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of Australian and Solomon Islands flags

props.synopsis: Australia and Solomon Islands have made little progress on a $190 million package to expand the Pacific nation’s police force, almost a full year after the high-profile initiative was announced.

title.children: Australia's $190m policing deal with Solomon Islands stalls over 'language'

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man engaged in "deceptive" conduct when he raped a woman during a house party and tried to cover it up, prosecutors say.

title.children: Melbourne man faked evidence to cover up house party rape, court told

image.altText: A man with short hair tries to cover his face with a piece of paper

props.synopsis: The court heard Thomas Stojanovski was financially motivated to help fund his illicit substance abuse for an injury he was dealing with at the time.

title.children: Sydney man offered $1K for role in anti-Israel vandalism spree

image.altText: Hail next to a hand

props.synopsis: The region has been hit by another round of storms which brought large and even giant hailstones. Is this the new normal?

title.children: Are hailstorms getting more frequent in south-east Queensland?

image.altText: A close up photo shows the face of Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: China's escalating confrontation with Japan is colliding directly with its attempt to join one of the world's most demanding trade agreements.

title.children: China's CPTPP bid runs into an old problem — Japan

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing black, speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warns his country's borders "cannot be changed by force", highlighting a key sticking point in negotiations with the US over a potential peace deal with Russia.

title.children: Zelenskyy warns Ukraine's borders 'cannot be changed by force'

image.altText: About six Myanmar youths sitting at desks in a concrete room.

props.synopsis: The US government is ending the temporary legal status of thousands of Myanmar nationals arguing they can safely return to the war-torn South-East Asian country.

title.children: US says Myanmar 'safe', terminates nationals' protection status

image.altText: Colourful stalls of different crypto companies with many punters asking questions.

props.synopsis: It's been a wild ride for bitcoin traders in recent months and, after a weekend of crypto and blockchain enthusiasm at a Sydney convention, sceptics continue to flag the risks.

title.children: 'Contagion' fears surface as bitcoin crash unsettles financial markets

image.altText: Auctioneer gestures to the crowd in front of a house he is selling. The sky is blue and a large crowd gather to watch

props.synopsis: Amid global warnings of impending financial doom, APRA and the Reserve Bank are far more concerned about a home-grown bubble, one that's been taking in oxygen for almost three decades.

title.children: Forget Wall Street, bitcoin and AI. Here's a real Aussie bubble

image.altText: Police vehicles parked in front of a house between trees.

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering 23-year-old student is facing trial in the NT Supreme Court, with the jury shown video footage of the home where Md Isfaqur Rahman died.

title.children: 'I'm coming back': Murder trial hears of victim's chance meeting with accused
